action_description: Jio initiated price cuts across several prepaid packs (₹50 cuts or increased data allowances).
notes: Major disruptive price move; incumbents did not match immediately.

action_description: Airtel launched new prepaid plans (₹149/₹399 with 1GB/day); Jio responded same day with extra data promotion ('Double Dhamaka').
Reliance Jio removed domestic IUC charges, effectively making off‑net voice calls free.
response_type: Partial match / public assurance (Airtel emphasized no change in its unlimited calling)
notes: IUC removal is TRAI‑sensitive; incumbents publicly reassured customers.

action_description: Airtel upgraded its ₹199 plan to offer 1.5GB/day (matching Jio's offering).
Airtel announced ~20–25% tariff hikes on prepaid plans; Vodafone Idea followed next day and Jio introduced pricier plans shortly after.
notes: Coordinated industry tariff increases over a short window.

action_description: Reliance Jio enacted price increases on prepaid/postpaid to support 5G investment; Airtel/Vi raised tariffs in response.
Vodafone Idea introduced new prepaid plans up to ~40% costlier and added off‑net call charges; described as a standalone move.

action_type: New product launch with price cut
action_description: Campa re-launched with deep-discount pricing (e.g., 2L at ₹49; 200ml at ₹10 vs ₹20 for Coca‑Cola).
response_type: Alternative strategy (Coke focused on distribution and ₹10 returnable glass bottles)
notes: Challenger pricing disrupted incumbents in smaller towns.

action_description: PepsiCo planned a budget ‘B‑brand’ ~15–20% cheaper than flagship Pepsi to blunt Campa's growth.
notes: Planned defensive product to protect regional share.

action_description: Coca‑Cola expanded distribution of ₹10 returnable glass bottles and planned regional/heritage brand reintroductions (e.g., RimZim).
notes: Tactical trade promotions rather than headline price cuts.

action_description: Tata Consumer reset price of Gluco Plus (ready-to-drink) in direct response to Campa's entry.
notes: Defensive price move to stabilize RTD sales.

action_description: Coca‑Cola's 'Half‑Time' campaign was countered by PepsiCo's 'Anytime is Pepsi Time' campaign.

action_type: Market share shift / incumbent price response
action_description: Market data showed Campa and Lahori Zeera gaining share in ₹10 segment; Coca‑Cola and PepsiCo launched new ₹10 packs.
public_sentiment_shift: Negative for incumbents; Positive for challengers
notes: Incumbents cut into low-end price point to defend share.

action_description: Jio launched All-in-One bundled plans combining data and voice.
Airtel bundled Xstream OTT services with prepaid plans.
notes: Shift from price wars to value bundling.

action_description: Jio launched commercial 5G services across major cities.
PepsiCo launched Sting energy drink at aggressive price points.
notes: Expanded beyond colas into energy drinks.

action_description: Coca-Cola expanded Kinley soda distribution nationwide.
Reliance expanded Campa Cola distribution to tier-3 towns.
PepsiCo marginally increased prices on select SKUs due to input costs.
